timeline.bodyText: If the above if-statement passes, then this if-statement will always be false. Thus you can use an else-if here or you could move this if-statement above the previous one and use an else-if on the previous one.
timeline.author: silverwolfg11

timeline.bodyText: This if-statement call is highly unlikely (but still valid). However, I wouldn't return on null (bad, in this instance, for control flow and you would skip the dev message) and would instead use a simple != null check
timeline.author: silverwolfg11

timeline.bodyText: All of these if-statements, are mutually exclusive so they can be prefixed with an else if
timeline.author: silverwolfg11

timeline.bodyText: Use this is as probably the last else statement (if you use else-ifs above). Also do not use system.out, use TownyMessaging instead, and probably with Invalid sender instead of null sender if you chose to do the else-ifs.
